segment.source: How to Configure the Client to Receive Package and Connection Groups Updates From the Publishing Server
segment.target: How to Configure the Client to Receive Package and Connection Groups Updates From the Publishing Server

segment.source: How to Configure the Client to Receive Package and Connection Groups Updates From the Publishing Server
segment.target: How to Configure the Client to Receive Package and Connection Groups Updates From the Publishing Server

segment.source: How to Configure the Client to Receive Package and Connection Groups Updates From the Publishing Server
segment.target: How to Configure the Client to Receive Package and Connection Groups Updates From the Publishing Server

segment.source: Deploying packages and connection groups using the App-V 5.1 publishing server is helpful because it offers single-point management and high scalability.
segment.target: Deploying packages and connection groups using the App-V 5.1 publishing server is helpful because it offers single-point management and high scalability.

segment.source: Use the following steps to configure the App-V 5.1 client to receive updates from the publishing server.
segment.target: Use the following steps to configure the App-V 5.1 client to receive updates from the publishing server.

segment.source: For the following procedures the management server was installed on a computer named MyMgmtSrv, and the publishing server was installed on a computer named MyPubSrv.
segment.target: For the following procedures the management server was installed on a computer named MyMgmtSrv, and the publishing server was installed on a computer named MyPubSrv.

segment.source: To configure the App-V 5.1 client to receive updates from the publishing server
segment.target: To configure the App-V 5.1 client to receive updates from the publishing server

segment.source: Deploy the App-V 5.1 management and publishing servers, and add the required packages and connection groups.
segment.target: Deploy the App-V 5.1 management and publishing servers, and add the required packages and connection groups.

segment.source: For more information about adding packages and connection groups, see How to Add or Upgrade Packages by Using the Management Console and How to Create a Connection Group.
segment.target: For more information about adding packages and connection groups, see How to Add or Upgrade Packages by Using the Management Console and How to Create a Connection Group.

segment.source: To open the management console click the following link, open a browser and type the following: http://MyMgmtSrv/AppvManagement/Console.html in a web browser, and import, publish, and entitle all the packages and connection groups which will be necessary for a particular set of users.
segment.target: To open the management console click the following link, open a browser and type the following: http://MyMgmtSrv/AppvManagement/Console.html in a web browser, and import, publish, and entitle all the packages and connection groups which will be necessary for a particular set of users.

segment.source: On the computer running the App-V 5.1 client, open an elevated PowerShell command prompt, run the following command:
segment.target: On the computer running the App-V 5.1 client, open an elevated PowerShell command prompt, run the following command:

segment.source: This command will configure the specified publishing server.
segment.target: This command will configure the specified publishing server.

segment.source: You should see output similar to the following:
segment.target: You should see output similar to the following:

segment.source: The returned Id – in this case 1
segment.target: The returned Id – in this case 1

segment.source: On the computer running the App-V 5.1 client, open a PowerShell command prompt, and type the following command:
segment.target: On the computer running the App-V 5.1 client, open a PowerShell command prompt, and type the following command:

segment.source: The command will query the publishing server for the packages and connection groups that need to be added or removed for this particular client based on the entitlements for the packages and connection groups as configured on the management server.
segment.target: The command will query the publishing server for the packages and connection groups that need to be added or removed for this particular client based on the entitlements for the packages and connection groups as configured on the management server.
